Thanks for ''A Message to Web Designers: If It Ain't Broke, Don't Fix It''(Aug. 3). I have long been baffled why otherwise sensible business people allow Web page designers to produce designs that have too many colors and are hodgepodges of disparate thoughts and features.

Of course, laypeople being intimidated by anyone claiming artistic talent is nothing new. Web page designers who emphasize form at the expense of content produce pages that have no rhyme or reason and are visually bewildering. There is no obvious organization and nothing on the site is omitted -- everything is located somewhere on the first page, but almost always without any relationship to what is next to it. Too many colors are used, resulting in a mishmash.
ALBERT Z. K. SANDERS New York
